title.narrative: IMPROVED SANITATION & HYGIENE KNOWLEDGE& PRACTICE OF CAREGIVERS AND CHILDREN

description.narrative: Mothers, fathers, caregivers and children in selected districts have increased knowledge and skills to improve sanitation and hygiene behaviour and to demand quality services., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Mothers, fathers, caregivers and children in selected districts have increased knowledge and skills to improve sanitation andhygiene behaviour and to demand quality services.

description.narrative: 137,340 additional people live in 608 newly certified open defecation communities. Those persons adopted healthy sanitation, and hygiene practices, especially handwashing with soap/ash. Lessons learnt and best practices drawn from the implementation of CLTS in those communities were capitalised in the national CLTS manual. UNICEF support with WASH facilities in 116 Schools enabled 37,225 students to wash their hands proper when needed.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021
